DOC.detailed_description: Objectives : To define independent impact surgeon volume outcome pancreaticoduodenectomy ( PD ) single high-volume institution . Summary Background Data : The impact surgeon volume PD outcome still controversial . So far , data available retrospective multi-institutional review , consider in-hospital mortality outcome variable . Methods : Prospectively collect data 610 patient underwent PD August 2001 August 2009 analyze . Cut-off value categorize high low-volume surgeon ( HVS LVS , respectively ) 18 PD/year . Primary endpoint operative mortality ( death within 30-day post-discharge ) . Secondary endpoint morbidity , pancreatic fistula ( PF ) length stay . Demographic , clinical , surgical variable record .
